author: Mike Colias
title: GM, Toyota Trade Places in Lucrative North American Market - WSJ
text:
General Motors Co. and Toyota Motor Corp. are on divergent paths in the world’s most-profitable car market, North America, where GM is posting lofty profit margins while Toyota’s bottom line has been battered.
GM on Tuesday posted fourth-quarter operating profit of $2.9 billion in North America—a record for the period—while the region’s pretax profit margin for the full year hit 10.7%, the highest since the company’s bankruptcy nearly a decade ago.
